resources.string: Set aside a portion of your income for savings or investments before spending on anything else. It ensures financial security by prioritizing long-term savings and investment goals.
Here, every expense is justified each month. You start with a zero base and allocate funds only to what is necessary, ensuring efficient use of financial resources.

Divide your after-tax income into three categories: 50% for needs, 30% for wants, and 20% for savings or debt repayment. It\'s a simple framework for managing your finances by balancing essentials, personal desires, and financial goals
Frequently review and adjust your budget to reflect changes in your financial situation. It helps keep your spending in line with your current income and goals.
